magic_ring ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● 1/2dc -half_double_crochet ● 1/2 double_crochet decrease - half_double_crochet together ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● fo - fasten_off ● slip_stitch - slip stich materials ● yarn ● 3mm crochet hook - though you can use whatever hook you d like however it will change the size of the stocking *the larger the hook the larger the stocking* ● scissors ● darning needle - to sew in ends round 1 *the granny hexagon* mc *if you dont like magic circles you can certainly ch4 & slip_stitch into first chain to form your ring* ch3 *counts as 1st double_crochet* 2dc ch2 *3dc cluster ch2* repeat x5 slip_stitch to the top of the ch3 & fo ©ashleymaglich if you are not changing colors you do not necessarily need to fasten_off at this point you should have 6 clusters *pull your center closed* round 2 starting in a ch2 space ch3 *counting as 1st double_crochet* 2dc ch2 3dc you will continue this pattern all the way around *3dc ch2 3dc* slip_stitch into the top of the ch3 &fo ©ashleymaglich round 3-12 continue with the granny cluster pattern for the next 10 rounds *use whatever color combos speak to you you are going to do 3dc ch2 3dc at every corner space 3dc in non corner spaces *just like you would a regular granny hexagon for color changes i personally start in a corner spot ch3 *counting as 1st double_crochet 2dc ch2 3dc then continue with the pattern of a granny hexagon i also work over my tails as i go but certainly do what feels comfortable for you ©ashleymaglich *you should have 12 granny rounds counting round 1 round 13 flatten your hexagon so you have 3 straight sides ©ashleymaglich you are now going to make 3dc clusters around these sides starting from the bottom & working your way up over & down *make sure you still make your corner spaces 3dc ch2 3dc ©ashleymaglich round 14-21 you are now going to be working on the leg of the stocking you can certainly make more row than i did however i did 8 row of granny clusters these are going to be alternating row so your row stay even you are going to be working just on the top of the hexagon shape now building up row 14 -
